critique: This document amends the Civil Service Rules. It aims to prevent discrimination based on political or religious opinions, race, and to ensure fair practices in civil service appointments and examinations. It also addresses the classification of employees, particularly in post offices, and provides for appointments without competitive examination in rare cases. The document includes provisions for veterans and those who have served beyond seas. It appears to promote a merit-based system while also considering veteran status. It does not seem to strongly favor one ideology over another, but it does aim to create a more inclusive and fair civil service. It also seems to expand federal control over civil service rules.
